pages.content: On| a |spring| morning,| there| was| a| little| ant| wandering| to| get| food.| He| went| and| went.| Finally,| he| found |a |little| bread |on |the| road.
He| was |very| happy| and| decided |to| carry| it| home.| He |tried| his| best| to| carry| it| on |his |shoulder.

“Come| on!| Come| on!| Carry| it| home.”
But| the |bread |was| too| heavy| for| the| little| ant| to |carry.| He |could |not| carry| it.

Little| ant| went |home |to| call| his| brother:| “Please| give| me |a |hand!”
Little| ant |and |his |brother| tried |their| best| to| carry| the| bread| home.

“Come| on!| Come |on!| Let’s| carry| it| home.”
But| the |bread |was |too| heavy |for| the| little| ant| and| his| brother| to| carry.| They |could| not |move| it.

His |brother| went |back |home| to| call| his| mom:| “Mom,| please| give| us| a |hand!”
Little| ant,| his |brother,| and |his |mom |tried| their| best| to| carry| the| bread| home.

“Come |on! |Come |on! |Carry| it| home.”
But| the| bread| was| too| heavy| and |fell| over| on| the| road.| They| could| not| carry| it.
His| mom| went| back| home |to| call |dad:| “Please| give| us| a |hand!”

Little| ant,| his| brother,| his| mom, |and |his| dad |carried| the| bread |together| on| their| shoulders.|
“Come |on! |Come| on!| Let’s| carry| it| home!”
How| fantastic!| The| ant| family| carried |the |bread |home.| That| night,| the |whole| family| gathered| around |the |table |to |enjoy |the |delicious| bread.
